data.title: AutoTarget issue with Tsla/Obli
data.body:
To reproduce, move a unit into tesla range, then move it out - the tesla coil won't reset its target  - should also happen with obelisk. Does not happen with turret/pillbox/flame turret.

![autotarget](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/566742/3207279/ea1439f6-edda-11e3-96ec-f9df0364af24.png)

data.title: Refactor AutoTarget scan and GPS interaction
data.body: Should also give us a slight performance boost due to the new caching

data.title: Issues with tanya
data.body:
1) Tanya has this C4-cursor when targeting destroyed oil pumps and after klicking she'll also move there and place some C4, but nothing will happen.
![tanyafail1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3205917/be3c3044-edbd-11e3-8daf-45a87c3b08ad.png)

2) When trying to target explosive barrels or even wire fence in the fog the C4-curser will be shown. After klicking this red attackline appears, but tanya doesn't move or shot there.

![tanyafail2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3205934/10a75944-edbe-11e3-9e21-0f1021b0921d.png)
![tanyafail3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3205935/114b7e0c-edbe-11e3-8f9a-17cb5416dee7.png)

data.title: broken gems
data.body:
Gems in RA are kinda broken.
Have not really looked into it yet, some changes to ore growth seem to have caused this.

Just compare the diamonds in the map editor, and then ingame.

This is also the reason why so many maps dont have a reasonable amount of gems, and also for those annoying invisible tiles where you can't build (as there are some invisible gems there).

Gems seem to be in the first stage of growing, while they should be at their max.

Greez

data.title: Adds/reworks some minibibs
data.body:
Just some sprite changes/additions (+ 2 simple yaml additions), so i hope it can get into the release.
No code changes, no extra features.

What I did:
I was not really satisfied with the sprites for the depot's minibibs in RA + CNC.
Made em much more subtle, i think it looks better.

Also, fixed the CNC hospital's minibib, and added the minibib for RA's hospital.

CNC's hospital/silo both used mb2x1 and MISS/FIX used mb3x1 earlier.
They each have their own sprites now (mbHOSP, mbSILO, mbMISS, mbFIX).

Thats all.
Compare #4914.

Screenies:
![fix cnc des](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1968396/3201973/b60d3624-ed8c-11e3-99ce-590fe3492587.png)
![fix cnc tem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1968396/3201981/bfba9d60-ed8c-11e3-9883-17f68956d079.png)

![hospital](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1968396/3201990/d13cf2d6-ed8c-11e3-8f6a-2cc3e5047a05.png)

![fix ra tem](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1968396/3202002/e5b7c704-ed8c-11e3-8d12-a23b7ac8f0ed.png)

How much do I get from selling this structure?

data.title: (Delete, misplaced report) IRC commands give different results
data.body: In irc the commands ]games and ]players refer to CNC/TD when they should both actually only say "TD"

data.title: Fixed rpmbuild warning: File listed twice
data.body: We were doing a recursive directory listing that RPM does itself. I tested it on build.open-ra.org and it also works on Ubuntu rpmbuild. Not sure why we added this.

data.title: Reduced the verbosity of the packaging build
data.body: "This log is too long to be displayed. Please reduce the verbosity of your build or download the the raw log."

data.title: Fixed not being pedantic enough with curly braces
data.body: after lessons learned from https://api.travis-ci.org/jobs/26845357/log.txt?deansi=true.

data.title: Fixed RPM deployment on Travis CI
data.body: Actually this could be it. DEB seems to have built, but did not deploy because RPM failed first.

data.title: Fixed Linux packaging failing Travis CI deployment
data.body: ~~Ignore the hacky Linux build scripts for now to simplify things and workaround "This log is too long to be displayed."~~ Tried to fix them instead.

data.title: (Fixed in playtest 2014-07-09) Tiberium growing inside the refinery
data.body:
Here you can see the tiberium growing under/inside the building.
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/3185169/cad3a35c-ec8f-11e3-8f12-9d203e6dee8e.png)

data.title: Tweaked Travis CI deployment
data.body:
- Fixed the wrong path stopping the upload.
- Don't build everything in parallel and don't hide it in logs to ease debugging.

data.title: Updated the Travis CI OAuth token (again)
data.body: This time I used `travis encrypt $OAuthToken` in a fresh clone of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA instead of my development repository which is probably recognized as Mailaender/OpenRA and these decryption only work for exactly that repository for obvious security reasons.

data.title: Vehicle stuck on repair facility
data.body:
I played a multiplayer game and i placed two power plants side by side pretty fast at the start of the match, later I got some damaged vehicles that I thought I should repair so I built a repair pad. Once the building was completed and was about to place the building I saw that it would be a good match between these buildings I built earlier, but something strange happened. The vehicle got stuck, the only solution I found to this was to sell the repair pad but I lost some money and time on it. So I decided to write a bug report about this issue.

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/3184375/2149cc82-ec83-11e3-898c-734b5b6e4b1d.png)

data.title: Concrete walls cant be sold beside buildings
data.body:
If you have a barrier behind a building you have to sell the building before you can sell the barrier.
![concrete wall can t be sold 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/3184023/b4831b4a-ec7c-11e3-88b2-731a83efd991.png)

data.title: Add developer shortcut to reload chrome files
data.body:
Hitting Ctrl+Shift+C will re-initialize the chrome provider,
reloading all chrome files instantly. Useful when changing the
UI.

Note: A new "RootWidget" was created to trap top-level (global)
shortcuts instead of putting everything in Widget.

data.title: Allow parachuting units to be attacked
data.body:
Currently units are invulnerable while parachuting. We should allow them to be attacked. 

Extracted from #5493

data.body: Because you have some open bounties, we thought you might want to display this badge in your README!

data.title: A tiberium tile that is impossible to harvest
data.body:
First I noticed that there was a tile with Tiberium the harvesters avoided and when it was the only tile left I marked one harvester and specified it to harvest the tile and saw that the red line indicating the units movement would not go to this tile no matter what. I then tried a number of other harvesters and no luck getting them to harvest it. I tried to walk a infantry unit (commando) on the tile and he would walk on it, then removed him to see it that changed anything but it diden't so i damaged the tiberium with a mammoth tank, no change, then i (killed) the tiberium with 3 shot then 15 shots but could not kill the tiberium. What i mean is that the animation of tiberium was gone but the harvesters still hade the attack symbole on the tile but would not enter the tile still.
![tiberium that wont be harvested any time soon 1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7798635/3180271/130cafbc-ec2f-11e3-8e2e-6d52ce2e43e5.png)
## <bountysource-plugin>

Does not occur every time.

(I thought I remembered a similar shellmap issue before, but I could not find it.)

data.title: Tried to get Travis deployment under control
data.body: Separated from https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5538.

data.title: Shift-keystroke for queueing 5 units at a time
data.body:
It would be great if you could use the keyboard to queue 5 units at a time.

Take building a rifleman (shortcut key = `i`) as an example. Currently,
- clicking the Rifleman tile queues 1 unit
- shift-clicking the tile queues 5 units
- hitting the `i` shortcut key queues 1 unit
- hitting `shift-i` queues 1 unit

It would be great if the last case (`shift-i`) queued 5 units, so the shift modifier works the same whether you're clicking or using a keyboard shortcut. I swear it used to work this way in a previous release (could be mis-remembering), but it would be a nice addition regardless.
## <bountysource-plugin>

Want to back this issue? **[Post a bounty on it!](https://www.bountysource.com/issues/2494508-shift-keystroke-for-queueing-5-units-at-a-time?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github)** We accept bounties via [Bountysource](https://www.bountysource.com/?utm_campaign=plugin&utm_content=tracker%2F36085&utm_medium=issues&utm_source=github).
</bountysource-plugin>

data.title: Crash when having a new production building with no production options
data.body:
I defined a new side in CNC and had not yet given them any aircraft to produce, but had given them a new helipad.
(uberhpad - Copy of hpad with Image: hpad tag added. No other changes)

Game crashed once I had built the uberhpad helipad.
Exception.log seemed to be indicating there being an empty list for the production options as the culprit.

Will post the logs later today.

Not sure if this is intended functionality or not (if so, just close this issue), but I would have expected a warning in the log file rather than a crash.

data.title: Sped up shroud rendering.
data.body:
Only update shroud within the visible screen area, rather than the whole map. This improves performance on larger maps significantly since large portions of the shroud do not need to be updated.

Also added some other minor tweaks for performance and general cleanup.

data.title: Avoid repeated work in AttackBase.
data.body: - Avoid enumerating the collection more than once in a method as it is not trivial.

data.title: Avoid redundancy in BeginFrame.
data.body:
- Cache the old resolution, scroll and zoom in BeginFrame, and don't bother updating the viewport parameters again until they change.
- Pass around scroll as an int2 to reduce the number of back-and-forth casts.

data.title: Make repair animation pause if player has no money.
data.body: This implements #5322. I tested it and seems to work. When player has no money, repair animation is paused and when he gets money again, repair animation continues from the paused frame.
